item.title: Republic Day 2025: 5 tech products to get from Amazon and Flipkart during the sale - India TV News
item.description:
Republic Day 2025: 5 tech products to get from Amazon and Flipkart during the sale

Date: January 2025
Source: India TV

The Republic Day Sale is approaching, featuring significant discounts on a variety of tech gadgets from Amazon and Flipkart. With a focus on both smartphones and non-smartphone tech, this sale promises great opportunities for shoppers.

  • Samsung Essential Monitor S3: Rs 7,599 - A 24-inch monitor with Full HD resolution and 100Hz refresh rate.
  • OnePlus Buds 3: Rs 4,499 - Buds with 44 hours of battery life and noise cancellation features.
  • Motorola EnvisionX 43-inch 4K Smart TV: Rs 21,999 - Features QLED panel with Dolby Vision.
  • iPad (10th Gen): Rs 28,999 - A budget-friendly tablet with advanced capabilities.
  • Apple MacBook Air M2 (16 GB): Rs 79,900 - A sleek laptop ideal for students and professionals.

Grab these deals before they’re gone!

item.title: Nothing Phone 3 Launch Seems Confirmed For Early 2025: When You Might Get It - News18
item.description:
Nothing Phone 3 Launch Seems Confirmed For Early 2025: When You Might Get It

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 Source: News18

Nothing is back in the news with updates about the Nothing Phone 3 launch timeline. The company is expected to reveal the new device in early 2025, as suggested by a leaked internal email from CEO Carl Pei.

  • The Nothing Phone 3 is anticipated to launch between February and March 2025.
  • CEO Carl Pei hinted at significant AI integration in the user interface and apps.
  • There are plans for a flagship device, following the company's focus on mid-range models in the prior year.
  • Additional models like Phone 3a and 3a Plus may be announced later in 2025.
“The Phone 3 will be a flagship phone and become a landmark smartphone launch in Q1 this year.” - Carl Pei

The launch of the Nothing Phone 3 is generating significant interest, with expectations that it will meet pre-launch hype and competitive market standards.

item.title: Hamas likely to release 33 hostages in first phase of truce deal with Israel: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Hamas Likely to Release 33 Hostages in First Phase of Truce Deal with Israel

Date: Jan 14, 2025 Source: CNN

The final draft of a ceasefire agreement was presented to both Israel and Hamas during talks in Doha, with expectations that Hamas will release 33 hostages as part of the initial phase of the deal.

  • Israel and Hamas are in talks over a truce deal including the release of hostages.
  • Most of the 33 hostages are believed to be alive, with some mortal remains also expected to be returned.
  • US leaders, including President Biden, emphasize the importance of closing the truce deal swiftly.
  • The peace proposal includes maintenance of Israeli forces' presence along key borders and allowances for residents' return.
  • The conflict has led to significant casualties, with over 46,000 Palestinians reported killed in Gaza since October 7, 2023.
“It’s there for the taking so the question is now can we all collectively seize the moment and make this happen.” - Jake Sullivan

This potential breakthrough represents a hopeful moment in ongoing negotiations aimed at ending violence and providing humanitarian assistance.

item.title: Happy Pongal 2025: Best wishes, greetings, cards, WhatsApp status, SMS, images to share this Pongal - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, Images, WhatsApp Status, Messages, Quotes and Greetings

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: Indian Express

Pongal is an auspicious Hindu festival celebrated primarily in southern India, especially Tamil Nadu. This year's celebration takes place from January 14 to January 17, enriching the community spirit through music, dance, and traditional dishes.

  • This year's Pongal festival is set for January 14 to 17, 2025.
  • It celebrates the Sun God and the harvest season.
  • Traditional dishes include the sweet rice dish called Pongal.
  • Festivities strengthen community bonds and include decorations of rangoli.
  • People are encouraged to share and spread joy through greetings and WhatsApp messages.
“Wishing you a Pongal filled with sweetness, happiness, and prosperity. Happy Pongal!”

In conclusion, Pongal is a time for celebration, reflection, and community connection, and sharing messages of joy enhances the festive spirit.

item.title: ‘Every social media influencer took Goa for a ride,’ says tourism minister, this time armed with data - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Every social media influencer took Goa for a ride,’ says tourism minister, this time armed with data

Publication Date: January 14, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

The Goa tourism department reported a significant increase in tourist arrivals for 2024, with the minister addressing recent misinformation spread by social media influencers.

  • A total of 1.04 crore tourists visited Goa in 2024, up from 86.28 lakh in 2023.
  • Domestic tourist arrivals grew by 22% while international tourists increased by 3%.
  • The Dabolim airport saw a 27% rise in passenger arrivals in December compared to the previous year.
  • Tourism director Suneel Anchipaka spoke on the misleading narratives propagated by some influencers.
  • Minister Rohan Khaunte emphasized the importance of accurate representation of Goa's tourism.
  • Khaunte discussed challenges like overcrowding and waste management, highlighting plans for sustainability.
“All sorts of rumours were spread about Goa tourism’s decline... Every tourist place has its challenges.” - Rohan Khaunte

In conclusion, Goa's tourism sector shows robust growth despite challenges and misinformation, with authorities aiming to promote responsible tourism practices.

item.title: Army General Upendra Dwivedi calls out Pakistan over terrorism, says no troop cuts at LAC - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Army General Upendra Dwivedi calls out Pakistan over terrorism, says no troop cuts at LAC

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent press conference, Indian Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi labeled Pakistan as the “epicentre” of terrorism, adding that a significant percentage of active militants in Jammu and Kashmir are of Pakistani origin. He emphasized that troop levels along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) will not be reduced this winter.

  • Gen Dwivedi stated that 80% of terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir are from Pakistan.
  • The Army has received emergency procurement powers for counter-terror operations amidst increasing infiltration attempts from Pakistan.
  • There has been a rise in terrorist activities particularly in North Kashmir and the Doda-Kishtwar region.
  • Despite the escalation in attacks, the 2021 ceasefire agreement with Pakistan remains intact.
  • The situation with China at the LAC is described as sensitive but stable, with no troop cuts planned.
  • Trust-building measures are ongoing, and troop deployment reviews can happen before summer.
“In recent months, increased terrorist activities were seen in North Kashmir. Last year, 60% of the terrorists eliminated were of Pakistan origin.” - General Upendra Dwivedi

The emphasis on a balanced military deployment along the LAC suggests a proactive stance by the Indian Army, maintaining readiness for any potential conflict while also addressing the challenges posed by terrorism.

item.title: Oil prices remain near four-month highs as markets weigh Russia sanctions impact - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Oil Prices Near Four-Month Highs Amid Russia Sanctions Impact

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Oil prices slipped at market open but remain close to four-month highs, with sanctions on Russian oil prompting buyers in China and India to seek new suppliers.

  • Brent futures declined by 22 cents to $80.79 per barrel.
  • U.S. WTI crude fell by 16 cents to $78.66 per barrel.
  • The Biden administration's sanctions are expected to significantly impact Russian oil revenue.
  • Sanctions are anticipated to remove about 700,000 barrels per day from the market.
"A large portion of Russia's shadow tanker fleet has been sanctioned... which would erase the surplus that we are expecting for this year." - ING analysts

These developments in oil prices highlight the global market's response to geopolitical tensions and supply challenges.

item.title: Women’s Ashes 2025 LIVE: Australia v England 2nd ODI - Sydney Morning Herald
item.description:
Women’s Ashes 2025 LIVE: Australia v England 2nd ODI

Publication Date: 2025-01-20 Source: Sports News

The ongoing Women’s Ashes series features a critical second ODI match where Australia is struggling to recover from a disappointing performance, having posted their lowest ODI score on home soil since 2009.

  • Australia is facing a challenging situation with their bowling strategy.
  • Ash Gardner took three wickets, and Kim Garth, Annabel Sutherland, and Alana King each took two.
  • Current captain Heather Knight contributed significantly with a score of 39 runs.
  • Australia needs to dismiss English openers Maia Bouchier and Tammy Beaumont early in the innings.
"That is Australia’s lowest score posted in an ODI on home soil since 2009."

The match is filled with tension as both teams strive for victory, indicating a closely contested series moving forward.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir, Ajit Agarkar Differ In Long-Term Captaincy Choices. Report Says India Coach Wants..... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir and Ajit Agarkar Clash Over India's Future Captaincy Choices

Publication Date: July 27, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The search for Rohit Sharma's long-term successor as captain of the Indian cricket team is underway, with differing opinions between head coach Gautam Gambhir and chief selector Ajit Agarkar regarding potential candidates.

  • Rohit Sharma's captaincy uncertainty following past retirement talks.
  • Controversy over Jasprit Bumrah's capability to handle the Test captaincy due to workload concerns.
  • The BCCI is considering Rishabh Pant and Yashasvi Jaiswal as potential vice-captains.
  • Significant changes in team leadership are expected post-Champions Trophy.
"The selectors are backing Rishabh Pant while Gambhir is favoring Jaiswal for the vice-captaincy role."

The outcome of these deliberations could significantly impact the team's direction and performance in the upcoming matches.

item.title: Indian stock market: 7 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, CPI inflation to HCL Tech Q3 Results | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indian stock market: 7 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, CPI inflation to HCL Tech Q3 Results

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Live Mint

The domestic equity market indices, Sensex and Nifty 50, are expected to open higher on Tuesday amid mixed global cues, following a significant crash on Monday.

  • On Monday, the Sensex and Nifty suffered substantial declines of 1.36% and 1.47%, respectively.
  • Rising crude oil prices, a depreciating rupee, and foreign capital outflows were primary contributors to the sell-off.
  • Asian markets showed a mixed response, with Japan's Nikkei down while South Korea's Kospi rose.
  • The Gift Nifty suggests a gap-up start, trading at around 23,280.
  • HCL Technologies reported an 8.4% QoQ increase in net profit for Q3, showing strong performance amidst market fluctuations.
  • Retail inflation in India eased to a four-month low at 5.22%, which may ease concerns for rate cuts from the RBI.
  • Strong direct tax collection growth indicates robust economic activity despite market volatility.
“Wide-spread selling across the sectors fuelled along with massive exits in mid and small-cap stocks further worsened the sentiment.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

This market turbulence reflects ongoing global trends and highlights the complexities of the current economic landscape, as various factors are contributing to the risk and resilience of the Indian stock market.

item.title: Another child tests positive for HMPV in Puducherry, 3 cases reported so far - ETHealthWorld
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Game Changer box office collection Day 4: Ram Charan starrer chases Rs 100 crore mark as collections fall - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Game Changer box office collection Day 4: Ram Charan starrer chases Rs 100 crore mark as collections fall below Rs 10 crore on first Monday

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: Times of India

The Ram Charan and Kiara Advani starrer earned just around Rs 8.50 crore at the box office on its first Monday, bringing the total close to Rs 100 crore.

  • First Monday collection was Rs 8.50 crore.
  • Total collection reached an estimated Rs 97 crore.
  • Opening day collection was Rs 51 crore.
  • During the weekend, the film saw a massive drop from Rs 21.6 crore on Saturday to Rs 15.9 crore on Sunday.
  • The Telugu version's earnings were down significantly, while the Hindi version maintained a more stable collection.
  • Criticism arose over alleged inflation of Day 1 box office collections.
“With a star-studded cast and high production values, expectations were sky-high for Game Changer.”

The declining trend in box office collections raises concerns about the film's ability to become a blockbuster, especially the potential to reach Rs 200 crore domestically.

item.title: No rift between coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Rohit Sharma: BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla - The Times of India
item.description:
No Rift Between Coach Gautam Gambhir and Captain Rohit Sharma, Says BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Times of India

Rajeev Shukla, Vice-President of BCCI, has clarified that there is no rift between the Indian cricket team's coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Rohit Sharma, addressing speculations that have circulated in the media.

  • Shukla's comments come amidst discussions about team dynamics.
  • He emphasized the importance of unity within the team.
  • The BCCI is focused on preparing for upcoming matches.
“There is complete harmony and understanding between the coach and the captain.” - Rajeev Shukla

This statement aims to quell any rumors concerning conflicts within the team, ensuring fans and stakeholders that the management is in sync.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025: Over 1 crore take dip in Sangam on Day 1; first ‘Amrit Snan’ today as millions gather on Makar Sankranti - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh Mela 2025 kicked off with an attendance of over 1 crore devotees taking a holy dip at Sangam. First 'Amrit Snan' would attract millions.

Date: Jan 14, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A day after over 1 crore people took a dip in the sacred Sangam, a record number of devotees are expected to take part in the first ‘Amrit Snan’ of the Mahakumbh Mela 2025 on Tuesday, January 14, on the occasion of Makar Sankranti in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Seers and Naga Sadhus arrived for the holy dip at Sangam early in the morning.

  • On Makar Sankranti (January 14), Shri Panchayati Akhara Mahanirvani and Shri Shambhu Panchayati Atal Akhara will be the first ones to take Amrit Snan.
  • Akhil Bharatiya Akhara Parishad (ABAP) president Mahant Ravindra Puri mentioned the importance of the Amrit Snan.
  • The Mahakumbh 2025 is organizing a grand 45-day spiritual event.
  • Over 10,000 personnel, including local police and paramilitary forces, have been deployed for the event's security.
“Nine police teams will take all 13 akhadas to take holy dip, one after another - and it will continue till evening.”

This year's Mahakumbh Mela is marked by significant attendance and elaborate arrangements for the comfort and safety of devotees.

item.title: 'Fateh' box office collection day 4: Sonu Sood’s action drama sees a major drop, fails to make even Rs.1 - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Fateh Box Office Collection Day 4: Major Drop for Sonu Sood's Action Drama

Publication Date: (Date not provided) | Source: Times of India

Sonu Sood's directorial debut, Fateh, has faced a disappointing box office performance, failing to reach even Rs. 1 crore on its fourth day.

  • The film opened with Rs. 2.4 crores but has dramatically dropped since then.
  • Day 4 collection was only Rs. 85 lakhs, with total earnings so far at Rs. 7.60 crore.
  • Despite promotional efforts and a reduced ticket price, the film struggled to attract viewers.
  • Fateh is competing against Ram Charan’s Game Changer, which has grossed Rs. 97 crore in the same period.
“Sonu Sood’s directorial debut delves deep into the pervasive threat of cybercrime, a modern plague wreaking havoc in India.”

The film's lack of connection in storytelling has impacted its reception, despite strong action sequences and a relevant theme.

item.title: Rohit Sharma to join Mumbai's practice session today with Rahane, Iyer, Shardul. Is Ranji Trophy return loading? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma to Join Mumbai's Practice Session Ahead of Ranji Trophy

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

India captain Rohit Sharma will attend Mumbai's practice session today, signaling a potential return to the Ranji Trophy.

  • Rohit confirms attendance at practice alongside teammates Ajinkya Rahane, Shardul Thakur, and Shreyas Iyer.
  • The next Ranji Trophy match for Mumbai is on January 23 against Jammu and Kashmir.
  • BCCI emphasizes the importance of player participation in domestic cricket.
  • Rohit's last Ranji Trophy match was in 2015.
“I would always like everyone to play domestic cricket. That is how much importance domestic cricket needs to be given.” - Gautam Gambhir

Rohit's return to practice could indicate a significant step towards participating in the upcoming Ranji Trophy, reflecting the ongoing efforts to boost domestic cricket engagement.

item.title: Japan issues tsunami advisory after 6.9 magnitude earthquake: What is the ring of fire? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Japan Issues Tsunami Advisory After 6.9 Magnitude Earthquake

Date: January 13, 2025   Source: The Indian Express

A strong earthquake struck the Kyushu region of Japan, prompting tsunami advisories for coastal areas. Residents have been urged to evacuate as precautionary measures were implemented.

  • A 6.9 magnitude earthquake hit southwestern Japan at 9:19 pm local time.
  • The quake’s epicenter was determined to be at a depth of 30 kilometers.
  • Tsunami advisories were issued for waves up to one meter in Miyazaki and Kochi Prefectures.
  • A minor tsunami of 20 centimeters was reported in Miyazaki city.
  • The incident has raised questions regarding its relation to the Nankai Trough.
“Basically, when a ‘downgoing’ oceanic plate [like the Pacific Plate] is shoved into a hotter mantle plate, it heats up, volatile elements mix, and this produces the magma.”

The ring of fire is known for its geological activity, making Japan susceptible to earthquakes and volcanic eruptions.

item.title: Horoscope Today, January 14 By Astrologer Sundeep Kochar: Aries, Unexpected Things May Occur - Zee News
item.description:
Horoscope Today, January 14 By Astrologer Sundeep Kochar: Aries, Unexpected Things May Occur

Date: January 14, 2023

Source: Zee News

Astrologer Dr. Sundeep Kochar provides daily horoscope predictions for all 12 zodiac signs. This article highlights the specific insights and predictions for each sign.

  • Aries: Unexpected things may occur; embrace the positive changes.
  • Taurus: Plan a solo trip to recharge.
  • Gemini: Socialize with friends and family at a gathering.
  • Cancer: Expect compliments that boost your confidence.
  • Leo: Financial advice to help a close one.
  • Virgo: Handle new responsibilities with confidence.
  • Libra: Enjoy good news and positive interactions.
  • Scorpio: Manage tasks even with low energy; take breaks.
  • Sagittarius: Stay active; maintain hydration and nutrition.
  • Capricorn: Focus on self-care; avoid social interactions.
  • Aquarius: Clear misunderstandings with a loved one.
  • Pisces: Embrace a positive outlook and new opportunities.
“Unexpected things may occur today, and everything you’ve been hoping for will fall into place.” - Dr. Sundeep Kochar

This horoscope provides an insight into the influences of the stars on each zodiac sign, encouraging self-reflection and positivity for the day ahead.

item.title: England send Australia in, both sides unchanged - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Australia Suffers Stunning Collapse Against England in ODI

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: ESPN Cricinfo.

In a surprising turn of events at the Junction Oval in Melbourne, Australia was bowled out for just 180 runs, thanks to exceptional bowling performances from Alice Capsey and Sophie Ecclestone.

  • England's Alice Capsey took 3 wickets for 22 runs, while Sophie Ecclestone claimed 4 for 35.
  • Australia lost 8 wickets for just 49 runs during their innings.
  • Ellyse Perry scored 60 runs but couldn't prevent the collapse.
  • This marked the first time Australia was bowled out at the Junction Oval in nine completed ODIs.
“Australia lost 8 for 49 to be bowled out in 44.3 overs.”

The match showcased the unpredictability of cricket, highlighting England's strategic bowling changes and Australia's struggles under pressure.

item.title: India Squad For ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Sunil Gavaskar And Irfan Pathan Announce Picks - News18
item.description:
India Squad For ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Sunil Gavaskar And Irfan Pathan Announce Picks

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: News18

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is yet to announce the Indian men’s cricket team squad for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy, but former cricketers Sunil Gavaskar and Irfan Pathan revealed their preferred picks.

  • The official squad announcement is expected on January 19, 2025.
  • Sunil Gavaskar emphasized backing KL Rahul and Shreyas Iyer based on their recent performances.
  • Irfan Pathan highlighted the importance of having a balanced batting lineup.
“If I am sitting there I will say who has done really well in the recent past. KL Rahul had a fantastic 50-over World Cup.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar and Pathan’s proposed squad includes Rohit Sharma, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli, KL Rahul, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Kuldeep Yadav, Mohammed Shami, Jasprit Bumrah, Shubman Gill, Sanju Samson, Mohammed Siraj, and Nitish Kumar Reddy.

Their insights reflect both personal preferences and strategic considerations as the ICC Champions Trophy approaches.

item.title: Army chief backs women officers after Lt General criticised their performance - The Times of India
item.description:
Army Chief Supports Women Officers Amid Criticism

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

In a recent statement, the Army Chief defended women officers following criticism from Lt General regarding their performance in the military.

  • The Army Chief emphasized the importance of women in the armed forces.
  • The statement comes in response to growing concerns about gender equality in the military.
  • Women officers have increasingly occupied significant roles in various military operations.
“The contribution of women officers is invaluable, and their role must be recognized and respected,” stated the Army Chief.

The Army Chief's support highlights the ongoing discussions surrounding women's roles in the military and aims to foster a more inclusive environment within the armed forces.

item.title: Scorpio Daily Horoscope Today, Jan 14, 2025 predicts introspection and development - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Scorpio Daily Horoscope Today, January 14, 2025

Date & Source: January 14, 2025 | Hindustan Times

Today presents a chance for introspection and personal development. Scorpio, stay open to emotional and professional growth opportunities.

  • Introspection and opportunities for growth are key themes today.
  • Expect improvements in personal and professional relationships.
  • Clear communication in love can lead to deeper connections.
  • Work-related achievements may be recognized, suggesting potential advancement.
  • Financial growth opportunities may arise; remain cautious about spending.
  • Importance of health balance between relaxation and activity is emphasized.
"Opportunities for emotional and professional advancement are on the horizon."

Today is a significant day for Scorpio, characterized by introspection and potential growth. Embrace new opportunities while maintaining balance in all aspects of life.

item.title: Retail inflation dips to 4-month low of 5.2% in Dec - The Times of India
item.description:
Retail inflation dips to 4-month low of 5.2% in Dec

Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article reports a significant decrease in retail inflation in December, dropping to a four-month low of 5.2%. This decline signals improved economic conditions.

  • The inflation rate decreased from 5.8% in November to 5.2% in December.
  • This marks the lowest inflation rate recorded since August 2023.
  • Analysts suggest that a decrease in food prices contributed significantly to this dip.
  • The trend could affect policy decisions regarding interest rates.
“This drop in retail inflation presents a more stable economic outlook for consumers.”

In conclusion, the reduction in retail inflation may influence economic policies and consumer behavior positively.

item.title: Nag Mark 2 aces field trial: Top 5 insights from India's anti-tank missile - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Nag Mark 2 aces field trial: Top 5 insights from India's anti-tank missile

Date: Jan 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) successfully conducted field evaluations of the Nag Mark 2 missile, which is now ready for induction into the Indian Army.

  • Nag Mark 2 is a third-generation fire-and-forget anti-tank guided missile.
  • The trials validated the missile's firing range, as it successfully destroyed all designated targets.
  • The Nag Mark 2 features advanced technology for increased accuracy in complex environments.
  • It is designed to neutralise modern armoured threats, including those with explosive reactive armour.
  • The successful trials were acknowledged by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, emphasizing the collaboration between DRDO and the Indian Army.
"Field Evaluation Trials of indigenously developed Nag Mk 2... were successfully flight tested at Pokhran Field Range." - Rajnath Singh

The successful trials of Nag Mark 2 represent a significant advancement in India's defense capabilities, affirming the country's commitment to enhancing its military technology.

item.title: India, China still locked in ‘degree of standoff’: Army chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi - The Indian Express
item.description:
India and China Maintain Standoff, Army Chief Advocates Diplomacy

Publication Date: Monday, January 8, 2024

Source: Indian Army Press Conference

General Upendra Dwivedi states India and China are in a continued standoff, calling for renewed diplomatic efforts to rebuild trust.

  • General Dwivedi highlighted the need for a new definition of trust between India and China.
  • Diplomatic negotiations are being prioritized to resolve ongoing tensions.
  • The Army chief acknowledged both nations have made alterations to their territorial positions since April 2020.
  • Decision-making authority has been devolved to corps commanders to address minor issues promptly.
  • The situation in Eastern Ladakh remains stable but sensitive, according to General Dwivedi.
“The trust between the two countries has to have a new definition.” - General Upendra Dwivedi

The Indian Army continues to navigate the complexities of the India-China standoff, emphasizing the importance of cooperation and gradual progress through diplomatic channels.

item.title: No difference between PM and Kejriwal, says Rahul as he targets Congress’s INDIA ally - The Hindu
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi Criticizes Kejriwal, Claims No Difference with PM Modi Ahead of Delhi Assembly Elections

Date: January 14, 2025
Source: The Hindu

In his first public event ahead of the February 5 Assembly election, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticized Arvind Kejriwal, equating him with PM Modi over rising corruption and pollution in Delhi.

  • Rahul Gandhi accused Kejriwal of failing to keep promises on corruption and pollution.
  • He emphasized that both Kejriwal and Modi make “false promises” to the public.
  • Gandhi pledged that a caste survey would be conducted if Congress wins the election.
  • He highlighted issues of inflation and wealth disparity, blaming both leaders for benefiting billionaires.
“Inflation is at its peak. Poor people are becoming poorer and the rich people are growing richer.”

Gandhi urged citizens to vote for Congress to ensure development akin to previous governance under Sheila Dikshit.
